meanings.sent1: The elephant with the tuskiest tusks won the competition.
meanings.sent2: The walrus proudly showed off its tuskiest teeth.
meanings.sent3: The walrus joked that it needed sunglasses to protect its tuskiest tusks from the sun.
meanings.sent4: The walrus's tuskiest tusks gleamed in the sunlight like polished ivory.
meanings.sent5: The image of the walrus with the tuskiest tusks stayed in my mind long after I left the zoo.

meanings.sent1: In the collection, the tusk with the tuskiest curve was the most valuable.
meanings.sent2: The mammoth's tusk was the tuskiest artifact in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer humorously referred to the tuskiest tusk as the 'king of all tusks'.
meanings.sent4: The tusk, tuskiest of them all, stood out like a beacon among the artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The museum guide made sure to point out the tuskiest tusk to all the visitors, ensuring it was a highlight of the tour.
